full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Basin Cleanup, Flatrock, Newfoundland

**Reference Number:** CB-6931-84504427
**Solicitation Number:** 30004526
**Publication Date:** 4 July 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** 20 October 2023, 14:00:00
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 21 August 2023
**Expected Contract End Date:** 31 October 2023

### Tender Overview

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada is inviting contractors to submit tenders for the basin cleanup project at Flatrock, Newfoundland. The scope of work includes dredging services, excavation, and removal of rock and armour stone units. The contractor will also be responsible for disposing of the removed rock and performing any necessary repairs to the seawall.

### Project Details

* The project involves dredging the existing basin to a depth of -2.0m LNT (Lowest Normal Tide)
* Excavation and removal of rock from behind the existing seawall, including armour stone units
* Disposal of removed rock in a designated area
* The contractor must perform and complete the work within 8 weeks

### Important Requirements

* Bidders are recommended to familiarize themselves with the site by visiting and reviewing the conditions, risks, and necessary measures before submitting a bid
* The contractor must comply with all relevant Health and Safety Requirements, as specified in Specification Section 01 35 29

### Contact Information

* For more information, please contact:
	+ Tammy O'Toole, Fisheries and Oceans Canada
	+ Email: [tammy.otoole@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:tammy.otoole@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
	+ Phone: (343) 550-1758

### Tender Documents

The tender documents, including the Drawings and Specifications, can be downloaded from the Canada Buys website:

* English: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6931/30004526---rfq-en.pdf>
* French: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6931/30004526---ddq-fr.pdf>

Please ensure that all submissions are received by the tender closing date and time to be considered. Note that only Canadian based contractors are eligible to submit tenders for this project. The lowest price will be the deciding factor for the contract award
